fsal_unlink.c

00004 
00014 #ifdef HAVE_CONFIG_H
00015 #include "config.h"
00016 #endif
00017 
00018 #include "fsal.h"
00019 #include "fsal_internal.h"
00020 #include "fsal_convert.h"
00021 
00022 
00046 fsal_status_t FSAL_unlink(
00047     fsal_handle_t           * p_parent_directory_handle,     /* IN */
00048     fsal_name_t             * p_object_name,        /* IN */
00049     fsal_op_context_t       * p_context,                 /* IN */
00050     fsal_attrib_list_t      * p_parent_directory_attributes  /* [IN/OUT ] */
00051 ){
00052 
00053   fsal_status_t status;
00054   fsal_posixdb_status_t statusdb;
00055   int rc, errsv;
00056   struct stat buffstat, buffstat_parent; 
00057   fsal_path_t fsalpath;
00058   fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t info;
00059   
00060   /* sanity checks. */
00061   if ( !p_parent_directory_handle || !p_context || !p_object_name)
00062     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_unlink);
00063   
00064   /* check credential */
00065   /* need to be able to 'read' the parent directory & to delete it */
00066   
00067   
00068   /* build the destination path */
00069   status = fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle(p_context, p_parent_directory_handle, 1, &fsalpath, &buffstat_parent);
00070   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_unlink);
00071   
00072   status = fsal_internal_appendFSALNameToFSALPath(&fsalpath, p_object_name);
00073   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_unlink);
00074   
00075   /* 
00076    *  Action depends on the object type to be deleted.
00077    */
00078 
00079   TakeTokenFSCall();
00080   rc = lstat(fsalpath.path, &buffstat);
00081   errsv = errno;
00082   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00083   if ( rc ) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_unlink);
00084 
00085   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( status = fsal_internal_posix2posixdb_fileinfo(&buffstat, &info) ) )
00086     Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_unlink);
00087 
00088   /**************************************************************
00089    * Lock the handle entry related to this file in the database *
00090    **************************************************************/
00091   
00092   statusdb = fsal_posixdb_lockHandleForUpdate( p_context->p_conn, &info);
00093   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(status = posixdb2fsal_error(statusdb)) ) {
00094     fsal_posixdb_cancelHandleLock( p_context->p_conn );
00095     Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_unlink);
00096   }
00097   
00098   /****************
00099    * CHECK ACCESS *
00100    ****************/
00101   if ( (buffstat_parent.st_mode & S_ISVTX) /* Sticky bit on the directory => the user who wants to delete the file must own it or its parent dir */
00102        && buffstat_parent.st_uid != p_context->credential.user 
00103        && buffstat.st_uid != p_context->credential.user 
00104        && p_context->credential.user != 0 ) {
00105     fsal_posixdb_cancelHandleLock( p_context->p_conn );
00106     Return(ERR_FSAL_ACCESS, 0, INDEX_FSAL_unlink);
00107   }
00108   
00109   if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status = fsal_internal_testAccess( p_context, FSAL_W_OK | FSAL_X_OK, &buffstat_parent, NULL ) ) ) {
00110     fsal_posixdb_cancelHandleLock( p_context->p_conn );
00111     Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_unlink);
00112   }
00113   
00114 
00115   /******************************
00116    * DELETE FROM THE FILESYSTEM *
00117    ******************************/
00118   TakeTokenFSCall();
00119   /* If the object to delete is a directory, use 'rmdir' to delete the object, else use 'unlink' */
00120   rc = (S_ISDIR(buffstat.st_mode)) ? rmdir(fsalpath.path) : unlink(fsalpath.path);
00121   errsv = errno;
00122   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00123   if ( rc ){
00124     fsal_posixdb_cancelHandleLock( p_context->p_conn );
00125     Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_unlink);
00126   }
00127   
00128 
00129 
00130   /****************************
00131    * DELETE FROM THE DATABASE *
00132    ****************************/
00133 
00134   /* We have to delete the path from the database, and the handle if the object was a directory or has no more hardlink */
00135   statusdb = fsal_posixdb_delete( p_context->p_conn, p_parent_directory_handle, p_object_name, &info );
00136   /* After this operation, there's no need to 'fsal_posixdb_cancelHandleLock' because the transaction is ended */
00137   switch (statusdb.major) {
00138     case ERR_FSAL_POSIXDB_NOERR:
00139     case ERR_FSAL_POSIXDB_NOENT:
00140       /* nothing to do */
00141       break;
00142     default:
00143       if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(status = posixdb2fsal_error(statusdb)) ) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_unlink);
00144   }
00145   
00146   /***********************
00147    * FILL THE ATTRIBUTES *
00148    ***********************/
00149 
00150   if ( p_parent_directory_attributes ) {
00151     status = posix2fsal_attributes(&buffstat_parent, p_parent_directory_attributes);
00152     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR(status) ) {
00153       FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( p_parent_directory_attributes->asked_attributes );
00154       FSAL_SET_MASK( p_parent_directory_attributes->asked_attributes,
00155           FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00156       Return( status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_opendir);
00157     }
00158   }
00159   /* OK */
00160   Return(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_unlink);
00161   
00162 }
